isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - PRESSURE TRANSDUCER

caution.para: The pressure transducer is not interchangeable with a pressure switch. To prevent damage to the A/C system replace a defective transducer only with the recommended part.

note.para: The pressure transducer can be removed and installed without removing the refrigerant from the A/C system.
Refer to Figure 16 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

svcprocinfo.para: The pressure transducer is located on the condenser-to-evaporator refrigerant line.

step1.para: Disconnect the electrical connection to the pressure transducer (1).
Unscrew the pressure transducer from the condenser-to-evaporator refrigerant line and cap the open fitting.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Pressure Transducer Locations (Typical Locations Shown)

step1.para: Install a new O-ring on the transducer fitting and lubricate the O-ring and threads with mineral-based oil.
Screw the pressure transducer onto the A/C line fitting and tighten to 9.5 to 20 N•m. (7 to 15 lbf-ft).
Connect the electrical connector to the pressure transducer (1).
